committed to opening markets wider- including for government procurement contracts- and to honoring foreign companies' intellectual property rights. announced on Wednesday that it will audit government-office software use and publish the audit's results. If the audit is thorough, the additional transparency on this issue should result in greater software sales for US companies, said John Frisbie, Barack Obama of the US-China Business Council, in a statement. Only 1 in 10 users of Microsoft software in China has paid for the product, said Steve Ballmer , Microsoft's chief executive officer
